title: TBS (American TV channel)
summary: TBS (originally an abbreviation for Turner Broadcasting System) is an American pay television network owned by the Turner Networks division of WarnerMedia Studios & Networks.[1] It carries a variety of programming, with a focus on comedy, along with some sports events, including Major League Baseball, National Hockey League, and the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament. As of September 2018, TBS was received by approximately 90.391 million households that subscribe to a pay television service throughout the United States.[2]
